'WrocÅaw' ; ; ( , known also by several alternative names), situated on the
River Oder () in Lower Silesia, is the largest city in western Poland.

WrocÅaw is the historical capital of Silesia, and today is the capital of the
Lower Silesian Voivodeship. At various times it has been part of the Kingdom of
Poland, Bohemia, the Austrian Empire, Prussia, and Germany; it has been part of
Poland since 1945, as a result of border changes after World War II. Its
population in 2011 was 631,235, making it the fourth largest city in Poland.

WrocÅaw was the host of EuroBasket 1963, FIBA EuroBasket 2009, and UEFA Euro
2012; it will host the 2014 FIVB Men's Volleyball World Championship and, in
2017, the World Games, a competition in 37 non-olympic sport disciplines. The
city has been selected as a European Capital of Culture for 2016.
